One possible solution is to implement a centralized security management system that allows for real-time monitoring and control of all security protocols across all locations. This would provide a comprehensive view of the company's security posture and enable the security team to quickly respond to any threats.

Another idea is to incorporate artificial intelligence and machine learning into the security solution. This would allow the system to learn from past threats and identify potential vulnerabilities, enabling proactive measures to be taken to prevent future attacks.

A multi-layered approach could be taken, combining network security, endpoint protection, and data encryption to provide a robust security solution. This would protect against various types of attacks, including malware, phishing, and data breaches.

Implementing a security awareness training program for all employees could also be an effective solution. This would help to educate employees on best practices for cyber security and reduce the risk of human error, which is a common cause of security breaches.

A cloud-based security solution could also be considered. This would provide scalable and cost-effective security for the company, allowing for easy integration with existing systems and the ability to quickly add or remove resources as needed.
